result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devanta Marcus Mixon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devanta Marcus Mixon appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting Attorney Careen Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed an Attorney. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  dismissal of this case.  (Devanta M. Mixon - #2022009831, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Letter from defendant re:  Motion for Untimely Appointed Counsel.  (Devanta M. Mixon - #2022009831, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Devanta Marcus Mixon appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed an Attorney.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Branch PE.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devanta Marcus Mixon not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with A.L and J.L.W
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Devanta Marcus Mixon in court with attorney Theodore D. Kafkas.  Defendant Devanta Marcus Mixon in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense  a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS NOT ELGIBLE FOR A PUBLIC DEFENDER.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
